definitions.body: : Pr 11:2 insolence, presumptuousness (on format. cf. Lag:BN 204, Anm.), abs. ´[[ז]] De 17:12 + 7 t.; cstr. [[זְדוֹן]] Je 49:16, Ob:Ob 3; sf. [[זְדׂנְךָ]] 1Sa 17:28; —
insolence, presumption toward men; affirmed of David by Eliab 1Sa 17:28 (‖[[רׂעַ לְבָבֶָךָ]]); usu.

of presumptuous godlessness (cf. [[זוּד]], [[זֵד]]), exhibited in disobedience to priest or judge De 17:12; in false prediction De 18:22; in gen. Pr 11:2 (opp. [[חְנוּעִים]]), Pr 13:10; ´[[עֶבְרַת ז]] Pr 21:24 (cf. [[זֵד]]); [[לִבֶָּךָ]] ´[[ז]]) Je 49:16 ( = Ob:Ob 3) presumption of thine heart; of Babylon personif. under fig. of ´[[ז]] Je 50:31, Je 50:32; dub. is ´[[פָּרַח הַזּ]] Ez Eze 7:10 insolence hath blossomed (preceded by [[חָץ הַמַּטֶּה]]) i.e. either of Isr. as demanding punishment, or of Babylon as instr. of punishment.
